newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina automaker may set new output stoppages.
newsitem.headline: Argentina automaker may set new output stoppages.

text.p: Argentine automaker CIADEA SA said Thursday a partial interruption of output for several days this month was due to difficulties its French licensor, Renault, had selling cars in Brazil.
CIADEA added that it could be forced to make more output stoppages in April.

CIADEA's President Manuel Antelo confirmed the reason for the output stoppages was "the revamping of our export program, specifically shipments to Brazil, because of Renault's difficulties in commercial distribution in that country.
